posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
This was another fun build idea I had, utilising the concept of making the favored class low to avoid multiclass exp penalties.

This is a halfling Druid / Cleric Zen Archer with a touch of rogue. 

It has dual divine spell books both up to level 9 spells so you can cast lots and lots of summons buffed by the Druid class bonus to them. 

It's got rogue skills for shortbow proficiency, a little sneak attack, lots of useful rogue class skills.

Cleric domains trickery and travel. WoG'ers will be pleased to note the new halfling deity implemented can take these domains.

Druids get empowered summons on WoG but if you take this build elsewhere you will want animal domain for empowered summons and trickery domain for invis.

Has 350hp. Base AB 40 ranged. With Rapid Shot / Divine Power / Haste you can do 6 attacks per round (hurrah!)

Eventually at level 39 one can turn into a dragon! (take an extra rogue skill dump mid epic if you don't want this by going Cleric 17 / Druid 17 / Rogue 6, you can see the huge skill dump at the end)

No multi class exp penalties either (hurray!)

Anyway I thought I would post this for your review and commentary.

Only one cleric/druid/rogue in the ECB archives I could find (maybe you know of more?), it isn't legal any more with the change to dragon shape:

posts.content: Animal domain would improve your summons, even the ones cast as a Druid spell.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks Empyre65 for your comment.
I think I'm just used to playing WoG and Druids automatically having stronger summons.
Perhaps is this not true in Vanilla NWN? I can't see anything in the NWN Wiki that Druids get stronger summons.
I'll have to include your suggestion if that's the case for players not playing WoG.
